title: CVE-LLM: Ontology-Assisted Automatic Vulnerability Evaluation Using Large Language Models
author: Rikhiya Ghosh (Siemens Healthineers USA), Hans-Martin von Stockhausen (Siemens Healthineers Germany), Martin Schmitt (Siemens AG Germany), George Marica Vasile (Siemens AG Romania), Sanjeev Kumar Karn (Siemens Healthineers USA), Oladimeji Farri (Siemens Healthineers USA), ...
relevance_why: The integration of large language models (LLMs) for vulnerability evaluation could be beneficial in enhancing automated solutions for audio-related security vulnerabilities due to the extensive reliance on software components in audio systems.
background: Automatically assessing vulnerabilities in software systems through the use of large language models trained on historical data and cybersecurity knowledge.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel LLM specifically tailored for the automatic evaluation of software vulnerabilities in medical devices, achieving an efficiency that significantly reduces the manual labor involved.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods in cybersecurity often relied on manually curated evaluations for assessing vulnerabilities, which are time-consuming and error-prone.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages a fine-tuned large language model with ontology enrichment, enabling it to assess vulnerabilities quickly and accurately without needing extensive manual input.

key_innovation: The use of cybersecurity ontologies to enrich vulnerability descriptions, allowing the model to generalize better to new threats without retraining.
real_world_impact: The deployment of this system can drastically reduce the workload for cybersecurity experts in medical device assessments, enhancing response times to vulnerabilities and ultimately improving patient safety.
limitations: Potential challenges include addressing hallucinations in generated comments and generalizing to unseen vulnerabilities.

new_terms.CVE: **Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures** - A list of publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities and exposures.
new_terms.LLM: **Large Language Model** - A type of model that uses deep learning techniques to understand and generate human-like text.
